page.title: 11OLD PLACES
page.content: WHITE MILL BRIDGE IS ONE OF THE OLDEST BRIDGES IN DORSET.IT SPANS THE RIVER STOUR.IT HAS A TRANSPORTATION PLAQUE AND SEVERAL V SHAPED BAYS IN WHICH YOU STAND WHILE TRAFFIC IS PASSING. CHRISTIANS HAVE BEEN WORSHIPPING AT ST MARY'S CHURCH FOR ABOUT 1,000 YEARS. BEFORE THE STONE CHURCH THERE WAS A WOODEN CHURCH THAT THE SAXONS BUILT. THE TOWER HAS 6 BELLS,3 OF THEM HAVE BEEN DESCRIBED AS THE OLDEST MEDIAEVAL BELLS IN DORSET.THERE IS AN OLD PACK HORSE BRIDGE AT MILL MOOR.THERE IS A MODERN BRIDGE NEAR IT.THERE IS A THATCHED COTTAGE HOLLY COTTAGE THAT I LIVE IN.IT IS ABOUT THREE HUNDRED YEARS OLD,HAS TIMBER FRAMING AND A SUN FIRE INSURENCE PLATE ON THE OUTSIDE WALL.YEARS AGO IF YOU DID NOT HAVE THE PLATE THE FIREMEN WOULD NOT PUT OUT A FIRE AT YOUR HOUSE
